trans-unit.source: There is a special view just for the WIP calculation accessed from the Job Card by clicking Navigate > WIP.

trans-unit.source: WIP Method

seg-source.mrk: WIP Method

trans-unit.source: Determines how WIP is calculated. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Determines how WIP is calculated.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Cost Value

seg-source.mrk: Cost Value

trans-unit.source: Percentage of Completion

seg-source.mrk: Percentage of Completion

trans-unit.source: Sales Value

seg-source.mrk: Sales Value

trans-unit.source: Completed Contract

seg-source.mrk: Completed Contract

trans-unit.source: Cost of Sales

seg-source.mrk: Cost of Sales

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: Cost Value, Cost of Sales and Completed Contract use the same calculation logic.

seg-source.mrk: Cost Value, Cost of Sales and Completed Contract use the same calculation logic.

trans-unit.source: Last WIP Date

seg-source.mrk: Last WIP Date

trans-unit.source: Indicates the last date on which WIP was calculated.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the last date on which WIP was calculated.

trans-unit.source: WIP Amount (LCY)

seg-source.mrk: WIP Amount (LCY)

trans-unit.source: Displays the calculated WIP amount (in local currency) between the last and the current WIP date.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the calculated WIP amount (in local currency) between the last and the current WIP date.

trans-unit.source: Prospective Cost (LCY)

seg-source.mrk: Prospective Cost (LCY)

trans-unit.source: Displays the calculated amount (in local currency) for future expenses between the last and the current WIP date.

trans-unit.source: Impending Losses (LCY)

seg-source.mrk: Impending Losses (LCY)

trans-unit.source: Displays the calculated amount (in local currency) for pending losses between the last and the current WIP date.

trans-unit.source: Navigate Tab

seg-source.mrk: Navigate Tab

trans-unit.source: The Navigate tab includes three action groups: Line, Views and WIP. The actions within each are described in the following sections.

seg-source.mrk: The Navigate tab includes three action groups: Line, Views and WIP.
The actions within each are described in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Line Action Group

seg-source.mrk: Line Action Group

trans-unit.source: The actions in the Line group are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The actions in the Line group are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Action

seg-source.mrk: Action

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Position Card

seg-source.mrk: Position Card

trans-unit.source: Opens the Job Position Card page, which provides a card view of all the information in the Job WIP view for the selected WBS position.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Job Position Card page, which provides a card view of all the information in the Job WIP view for the selected WBS position.

trans-unit.source: Dimensions

seg-source.mrk: Dimensions

trans-unit.source: Opens the Job Line Dimensions page, which shows dimensions relating to the selected WIP line.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Job Line Dimensions page, which shows dimensions relating to the selected WIP line.

trans-unit.source: Comments

seg-source.mrk: Comments

trans-unit.source: Opens the Job Comment Lines page, where existing comments can be viewed or new comments can be added for the selected WIP line.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Job Comment Lines page, where existing comments can be viewed or new comments can be added for the selected WIP line.

trans-unit.source: Views Action Group

seg-source.mrk: Views Action Group

trans-unit.source: The Views group provides direct access to the other views relating to the job. Each view is described in more detail in other topics.

seg-source.mrk: The Views group provides direct access to the other views relating to the job.
Each view is described in more detail in other topics.

trans-unit.source: WIP Action Group

seg-source.mrk: WIP Action Group

trans-unit.source: The actions in the WIP group are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The actions in the WIP group are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Action

seg-source.mrk: Action

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Calculate and Post WIP

seg-source.mrk: Calculate and Post WIP

trans-unit.source: Opens the Calculate WIP batch job, which calculates the project value for all sales positions with a Sales Code (refer to topic “Calculate WIP” on page 1 for more information).

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Calculate WIP batch job, which calculates the project value for all sales positions with a Sales Code (refer to topic “Calculate WIP” on page 1 for more information).

trans-unit.source: WIP Entries

seg-source.mrk: WIP Entries

trans-unit.source: Opens the Job Line WIP Entries page, which displays posted entries for the selected WIP line.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the Job Line WIP Entries page, which displays posted entries for the selected WIP line.

trans-unit.source: WIP G/L Entries

seg-source.mrk: WIP G/L Entries

trans-unit.source: Opens the General Ledger Entries page, which displays posted G/L entries for the selected WIP line.

seg-source.mrk: Opens the General Ledger Entries page, which displays posted G/L entries for the selected WIP line.

trans-unit.source: Calculate WIP

seg-source.mrk: Calculate WIP

trans-unit.source: This batch calculates the job value for all sales WBS positions. These are all lines with a sales code. There are different options for calculation. After calculation (or at the same time with calculation) the calculated values can be posted to G/L.

seg-source.mrk: This batch calculates the job value for all sales WBS positions.
These are all lines with a sales code.
There are different options for calculation.
After calculation (or at the same time with calculation) the calculated values can be posted to G/L.

trans-unit.source: Several valuation options can be selected which will influence the maximum value of WIP.

seg-source.mrk: Several valuation options can be selected which will influence the maximum value of WIP.

trans-unit.source: The calculation is started by clicking Calculate and Post WIP on the ribbon the Job WIP view.

seg-source.mrk: The calculation is started by clicking Calculate and Post WIP on the ribbon the Job WIP view.

trans-unit.source: : Calculate WIP

seg-source.mrk: : Calculate WIP

trans-unit.source: Expected Amounts

seg-source.mrk: Expected Amounts

trans-unit.source: Cost and Sales Values are calculated using the calculation values, released sums and estimates. Select to determine what is included in the calculation.

Select to determine what is included in the calculation.

trans-unit.source: WIP Max. Cost Range

seg-source.mrk: WIP Max.
Cost Range

trans-unit.source: Indicates the maximum amount of cost to be calculated as WIP. The options are Cost Amount and Sales Amount.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the maximum amount of cost to be calculated as WIP.
The options are Cost Amount and Sales Amount.

trans-unit.source: WIP Adm./Sales %

seg-source.mrk: WIP Adm./Sales %

trans-unit.source: Percentage value to reduce the WIP Max. Cost Range.

seg-source.mrk: Percentage value to reduce the WIP Max.
Cost Range.

seg-source.mrk: Calculate

trans-unit.source: : Job WIP view with calculated WIP

trans-unit.source: <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref383086991" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 4</MadCap:xref> shows the calculated values after running the WIP Calculation:

seg-source.mrk: <MadCap:xref href="#_Ref383086991" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 4</MadCap:xref> shows the calculated values after running the WIP Calculation:

trans-unit.source: All expected costs for all lines have been calculated.

seg-source.mrk: All expected costs for all lines have been calculated.

trans-unit.source: The prospective cost for WBS position 1. was calculated. The invoice sum was fully booked. Costs need to be considered for the following periods.

seg-source.mrk: The prospective cost for WBS position 1.
was calculated.
The invoice sum was fully booked.
Costs need to be considered for the following periods.

trans-unit.source: Impending losses have been calculated for WBS position 1.1.4. because the planned costs of the calculation have been exceeded. But only the calculated sales amount was calculated.

seg-source.mrk: Impending losses have been calculated for WBS position 1.1.4.
because the planned costs of the calculation have been exceeded.
But only the calculated sales amount was calculated.

trans-unit.source: WBS position 1.1.5. includes a job value (WIP) because one hour was credited. This hour caused consumption but no sales invoice exists.

seg-source.mrk: WBS position 1.1.5.
includes a job value (WIP) because one hour was credited.
This hour caused consumption but no sales invoice exists.

trans-unit.source: WBS position 1.1.6. has time sheet entries but no sales invoice so the full value is included in the job evaluation.

seg-source.mrk: WBS position 1.1.6.
has time sheet entries but no sales invoice so the full value is included in the job evaluation.

trans-unit.source: The “Calculate and Post WIP” batch job can be used to post the calculated values, which will create the G/L entries.

seg-source.mrk: The “Calculate and Post WIP” batch job can be used to post the calculated values, which will create the G/L entries.
